subject: Nutrition
title: MSG and Headaches
description: A 1-minute de-risking session on MSG and Headaches.

hook.text: In 1968, a doctor blamed MSG for headaches after Chinese food. A myth was born from one letter.

buildup.text: Monosodium glutamate is a flavor enhancer found naturally in tomatoes, parmesan, and mushrooms.

discovery.text: Dozens of double-blind studies failed to find a consistent link between MSG and headaches.

twist.text: The original 'Chinese Restaurant Syndrome' was based on one letter to a journal, not a study.

climax.text: The FDA, WHO, and EU all classify MSG as safe. The fear was rooted in bias, not biology.

punchline.text: One letter. Zero evidence. Decades of fear.

quiz.question: What is MSG found naturally in?
